intro: Causonis timoriensis var. mekongensis, commonly known as the Mekong causon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland and riparian habitats, thriving in moist and sunny conditions. It is often found along riverbanks and in swampy areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native environment.
